title: The phases of QCD reached in terrestrial and cosmic colliders
summary: We review the current state of knowledge of the phase diagram of QCD through lattice, effective field theories, and chiral models. Several sections through the three dimensional phase diagram are known for $N_f=2+1$ with good precision. Due to technical advances in lattice techniques over the last decade or so, new aspects of the phase diagram can now be explored. We review current lattice results. The newly acquired knowledge can be used to reconstruct the full phase diagram for physical QCD, \ie, $N_f=1+1+1$. We remark on the computations which would help understand this better, and what the current constraints are on matter in neutron star cores. We also remark on the physics of the chiral transition and neutron stars in the 't Hooft large $N_c$ limit.

AI.tldr: This paper reviews the current understanding of the QCD phase diagram through various theoretical approaches, focusing on recent advancements in lattice techniques that have enabled exploration of new aspects. It discusses the reconstruction of the full phase diagram for physical QCD and comments on the implications for neutron star cores and the chiral transition in the 't Hooft large $N_c$ limit.
AI.motivation: The motivation is to provide an updated review of the QCD phase diagram, incorporating recent technical advances in lattice techniques, and to discuss how this knowledge can be applied to understand the full phase diagram for physical QCD with $N_f=1+1+1$.
AI.method: The method involves a comprehensive review of the current state of knowledge from lattice calculations, effective field theories, and chiral models. It also evaluates the impact of recent lattice technique improvements on the ability to explore new sections of the QCD phase diagram.
AI.result: The result is a detailed discussion of the known sections of the QCD phase diagram for $N_f=2+1$ flavors, the potential for reconstructing the phase diagram for physical QCD, and the current constraints on matter in neutron star cores. Additionally, it provides insights into the physics of the chiral transition and its relevance to neutron stars in the 't Hooft large $N_c$ limit.
AI.conclusion: The conclusion suggests that while significant progress has been made in understanding the QCD phase diagram, further computations are needed to fully elucidate the phase structure for physical QCD, particularly in relation to the composition of neutron star cores and the behavior at the chiral transition.

title: The Fredenhagen-Marcu operator in the gauge-Higgs Z(2) LGT at finite temperature
summary: We explore the possibility to use the Fredenhagen-Marcu operator as an order parameter of the deconfinement phase transition in gauge-matter systems at finite temperature. Concretely, we compute by numerical simulations this operator in the (2+1)-dimensional Z(2) lattice gauge theory (LGT) with Z(2) gauge fields coupled to Z(2)-valued Higgs fields. Our conclusion is that the Fredenhagen-Marcu operator can indeed serve as an order parameter capable of distinguishing the deconfinement phase from the Higgs and confinement phases of the theory.

AI.tldr: The Fredenhagen-Marcu operator is evaluated as an order parameter for the deconfinement phase transition in (2+1)D Z(2) lattice gauge theory with Higgs fields, successfully distinguishing between deconfinement and other phases.
AI.motivation: To investigate if the Fredenhagen-Marcu operator can be used to identify the deconfinement phase transition in a system involving gauge and matter fields at finite temperature.
AI.method: Numerical simulations were carried out on the (2+1)-dimensional Z(2) lattice gauge theory, which includes Z(2) gauge fields coupled to Z(2)-valued Higgs fields, to compute the Fredenhagen-Marcu operator.
AI.result: The Fredenhagen-Marcu operator was found to effectively serve as an order parameter, capable of differentiating the deconfinement phase from both the Higgs and confinement phases within the theory.
AI.conclusion: The study concludes that the Fredenhagen-Marcu operator is a viable order parameter for identifying the deconfinement phase transition in the context of the (2+1)D Z(2) LGT with Higgs fields.
